subject: RE: [junit] TestCase Dependency Hierarchy
msgSnippet: ... be. ... it, you could at least ... J.B. No, I did not insult you, I honestly praised you. I felt things had become tense between you and I, a heated
messageBody:
J.B. wrote:

> Do you realize that by writing the foregoing you have insulted me?

> "I have to thank you for not being an idiot, because I expected you to
be."

> If you felt this way and truly couldn't control your impulse to express
it, you could at least
> have had the courtesy to do so in private.

J.B. No, I did not insult you, I honestly praised you. I felt things had
become tense between you and I, a heated debate can do that, and I was
impressed that you were level enough to let that slide.

Can we get past this, or not? I have no desire to insult you, to fight with
you. I am tired of the distractions.

regards

Adam
